pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto paṭṭo hoti cīvarakammaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Upananda the Sakyan had become skilled at making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.3.pli: So paṭapilotikānaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ karitvā surattaṃ suparikammakataṃ katvā pārupi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.3.eng: He made an upper robe of old cloth, well-dyed and beautifully made, and he wore it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.3.comm: For the rendering of saṅghāṭi as “upper robe”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.4.pli: Atha kho aññataro paribbājako mahagghaṃ paṭaṃ pārupitvā yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.4.eng: Just then a certain wanderer who was wearing an expensive robe went up to Upananda and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.6.eng: Please give it to me in exchange for my robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.10.pli: Atha kho so paribbājako taṃ saṅghāṭiṃ pārupitvā paribbājakārāmaṃ agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.10.eng: The wanderer put on the upper robe and went to the wanderers’ monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.12.eng: “This upper robe of yours is beautiful.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.17.pli: Atha kho so paribbājako—“saccaṃ kho paribbājakā āhaṃsu—‘katihipi myāyaṃ saṅghāṭi bhavissati. Soyeva me paṭo varo’”ti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.17.eng: The wanderer realized they were right,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.18.pli: yenāyasmā upanando sakyaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.18.eng: and so he returned to Upananda and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.19.pli: “handa te, āvuso, saṅghāṭi; dehi me paṭan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.19.eng: “Here’s your upper robe. Please give me back mine.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.20.eng: “But didn’t I ask you if you were sure?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.22.pli: Atha kho so paribbājako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.22.eng: Then that wanderer complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.23.eng: “Even householders give back to each other when they regret a trade.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.24.pli: kiṃ pana pabbajito pabbajitassa na dassatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.24.eng: How, then, can a monastic not do the same?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.25.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa paribbājakassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.25.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that wanderer,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.26.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.26.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.27.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā upanando sakyaputto paribbājakena saddhiṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.27.eng: “How could Venerable Upananda barter with a wanderer?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.28.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ upanandaṃ sakyaputtaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.28.eng: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Upananda:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.29.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, upananda, paribbājakena saddhiṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.29.eng: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.32.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, paribbājakena saddhiṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.32.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.34.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.34.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.35.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:1.35.1.eng: ‘If a monk engages in various kinds of barter, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.6.eng: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, or medicinal supplies; even a bit of bath powder, a tooth cleaner, or a piece of string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.8.pli: iminā imaṃ dehi, iminā imaṃ āhara, iminā imaṃ parivattehi, iminā imaṃ cetāpehīti. Ajjhācarati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.8.eng: if he misbehaves, saying, “Give that for this,” “Bring that for this,” “Trade that with this,” “Exchange that for this,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.9.pli: Yato kayitañca hoti vikkayitañca attano bhaṇḍaṃ parahatthagataṃ parabhaṇḍaṃ attano hatthagataṃ, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.9.eng: When it has been bartered—his own goods are in the hands of the other and the other’s goods are in his own hands—it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.10.eng: The goods should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.11.eng: “And, monks, they should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.13.eng: ‘Venerables, I have engaged in various kinds of barter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.15.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.19.1.eng: If it is bartering, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.20.eng: If it is bartering, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.21.eng: If it is bartering, but he does not perceive it as such, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.22.eng: If it is not bartering, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.23.eng: If it is not bartering, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.24.eng: If it is not bartering, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.26.eng: if he asks about the value;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.28.pli: “idaṃ amhākaṃ atthi, amhākañca iminā ca iminā ca attho”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.28.eng: if he says, “I have this and I have need of such-and-such;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.30.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.31.eng: The training rule on bartering, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.32.eng: The second subchapter on silk is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np20:2.36.eng: And two on wool, should take,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bahū patte sannicayaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were storing up many almsbowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.3.eng: When people walking about dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bahū patte sannicayaṃ karissanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics store up many bowls?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.5.pli: pattavāṇijjaṃ vā samaṇā sakyaputtiyā karissanti āmattikāpaṇaṃ vā pasāressantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.5.eng: Are they starting up as bowl merchants or setting up a bowl shop?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.8.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six keep extra bowls?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.9.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.9.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, atirekapattaṃ dhāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.13.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu atirekapattaṃ dhāreyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk keeps an extra almsbowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa atirekapatto uppanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Ānanda was offered an extra bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.2.pli: Āyasmā ca ānando taṃ pattaṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dātukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.2.eng: He wanted to give it to Venerable Sāriputta,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.4.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against keeping an extra bowl,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.10.eng: Venerable Ānanda thought, “What should I do now?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.11.eng: He told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.12.eng: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.14.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.15.eng: “Monks, you should keep an extra almsbowl for ten days at the most.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.16.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.16.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.17.1.pli: “Dasāhaparamaṃ atirekapatto dhāretabbo. Taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.17.1.eng: ‘A monk should keep an extra almsbowl for ten days at the most. If he keeps it longer than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.1.eng: For ten days at the most:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.2.eng: it should be kept ten days at a maximum.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.4.eng: a bowl that is not determined, nor assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.4.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.6.eng: there are two kinds of bowls: the iron bowl and the clay bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.7.pli: Tayo pattassa vaṇṇā ukkaṭṭho patto majjhimo patto omako patto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.7.eng: And there are three sizes of bowls: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.7.comm: Sp 1.602: Tayo pattassa vaṇṇāti tīṇi pattassa pamāṇāni, “Tayo pattassa vaṇṇā: there are three measures of bowls.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.8.pli: Ukkaṭṭho nāma patto aḍḍhāḷhakodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.8.eng: The large bowl: it takes half an āḷhaka measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.8.comm: Sp 1.602: Aḍḍhāḷhakodanaṁ gaṇhātīti magadhanāḷiyā dvinnaṁ taṇḍulanāḷīnaṁ odanaṁ gaṇhāti, “Aḍḍhāḷhakodanaṁ gaṇhāti: it holds rice to the quantity of two nāḷī measures of rice of the Magadha nāḷī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.9.pli: Majjhimo nāma patto nāḷikodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.9.eng: The medium bowl: it takes a nāḷika measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.9.comm: The medium size bowl is half the volume of the large bowl. Sp 1.602: Nāḷikodananti magadhanāḷiyā ekāya taṇḍulanāḷiyā odanaṁ, “Nāḷikodananti: rice to the quantity of one nāḷī measure of rice of the Magadha nāḷī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.10.pli: Omako nāma patto patthodanaṃ gaṇhāti catubhāgaṃ khādanaṃ tadupiyaṃ byañjanaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.10.eng: The small bowl: it takes a pattha measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.10.comm: The small bowl is half the volume of the medium size bowl. Sp 1.602: Patthodananti magadhanāḷiyā upaḍḍhanāḷikodanaṁ, “Patthodananti: rice to the quantity of half a nāḷī of the Magadha nāḷī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.11.eng: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.12.eng: If he keeps it longer than that, it becomes subject to relinquishment:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.13.eng: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eleventh day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.13.comm: According to the commentary this means the tenth dawn after one received the bowl. Sp 1.463: Cīvaruppādadivasaena saddhiṁ ekādase aruṇuggamane nissaggiyaṁ hotīti veditabbaṁ, “It is to be understood in this way: it is to be relinquished on the eleventh dawn including the day when the robe (or bowl) was given.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.14.pli: Nissajjitabbo saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.14.eng: The bowl should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.15.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.16.pli: Tena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.16.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.17.eng: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.18.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.19.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.20.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.21.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.22.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.23.pli: Ayaṃ patto itthannāmassa bhikkhuno nissaggiyo saṅghassa nissaṭṭho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.23.eng: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so, has been relinquished to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.24.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ pattaṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dadeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.24.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.25.pli: Tena bhikkhunā sambahule bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.25.eng: Or: after approaching several monks, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.26.eng: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.28.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.29.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.30.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.31.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.32.pli: Ayaṃ patto itthannāmassa bhikkhuno nissaggiyo āyasmantānaṃ nissaṭṭho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.32.eng: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so, has been relinquished to you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.33.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, āyasmantā imaṃ pattaṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dadeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.33.eng: If the venerables are ready, you should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.34.pli: Tena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.34.eng: Or: after approaching a single monk, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.35.eng: ‘This almsbowl, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.37.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.38.eng: The confession should be received by that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.39.eng: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.40.eng: ‘I give this almsbowl back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.41.1.eng: If it is more than ten days and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.42.eng: If it is more than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.43.eng: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.44.eng: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.45.eng: If it has not been assigned to another, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.46.eng: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.47.eng: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.48.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.49.eng: If it has not been broken, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.50.eng: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.51.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ pattaṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.51.eng: If he uses an almsbowl that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.52.eng: If it is less than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.53.eng: If it is less than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.54.eng: If it is less than ten days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.56.pli: antodasāhaṃ adhiṭṭheti, vikappeti, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, bhijjati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.56.eng: if, within ten days, it has been determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.56.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.58.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū nissaṭṭhapattaṃ na denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six did not give back a relinquished bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.3.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, nissaṭṭhapatto na dātabbo. Yo na dadeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.3.eng: “Monks, a relinquished almsbowl should be given back. If you don’t give it back, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.4.eng: The training rule on almsbowls, the first, is finished.
